content.question: Which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="y equals N open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>N</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 16"> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>16</mn> </math>?

choices.label: The horizontal, or t, axis ranges from 0 to 16 in increments of 1. The y axis shows no tick marks and no scale. Moving from left to right: The curve begins at the origin and increases to a relative maximum at t equals 4. The curve decreases back to the horizontal axis to reach a relative minimum at t equals 8. The curve increases to a relative maximum at t equals 12. Both relative maxima appear to have the same y coordinate. The curve decreases to reach the horizontal axis at t equals 16.

The horizontal, or t, axis ranges from 0 to 16 in increments of 1. The y axis shows no tick marks and no scale. Moving from left to right: The curve begins on the positive y axis and decreases to reach a relative minimum on the horizontal axis at t equals 4. The curve increases to reach a relative maximum at t equals 8. This relative maximum and the beginning point of the curve appear to have the same y coordinate. The curve decreases to reach a relative minimum on the horizontal axis at t equals 12. The curve increases to its ending point at t equals 16. The y coordinate of this point appears to be equal to the y coordinate of the beginning point.

The horizontal, or t, axis ranges from 0 to 16 in increments of 1. The y axis shows no tick marks and no scale. Moving from left to right: The curve begins at the origin. The curve increases to t equals 4 at a less steep rate, and becomes nearly horizontal at t equals 4. The curve increases from t equals 4 to t equals 8. The curve increases from t equals 8 to t equals 12 at a less steep rate, and becomes nearly horizontal at t equals 12. The curve increases from t equals 12 to t equals 16, at which point it ends.

The horizontal, or t, axis ranges from 0 to 16 in increments of 1. The y axis shows no tick marks and no scale. Moving from left to right: The curve begins at the origin. The curve begins nearly horizontal and then increases to t equals 4. The curve increases from t equals 4 to t equals 8 at a less steep rate, and becomes nearly horizontal at t equals 8. The curve increases from t equals 8 to t equals 12. The curve increases from t equals 12 to t equals 16 at a less steep rate, and becomes nearly horizontal again at t equals 16, at which point it ends.

content.answer: The horizontal, or t, axis ranges from 0 to 16 in increments of 1. The y axis shows no tick marks and no scale. Moving from left to right: The curve begins at the origin. The curve begins nearly horizontal and then increases to t equals 4. The curve increases from t equals 4 to t equals 8 at a less steep rate, and becomes nearly horizontal at t equals 8. The curve increases from t equals 8 to t equals 12. The curve increases from t equals 12 to t equals 16 at a less steep rate, and becomes nearly horizontal again at t equals 16, at which point it ends.

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
